bestBHT.bht: Do not become partakers with them warns against falling back into vices that displease God and expose to His wrath. Avoid fellowship with wicked workers and their wicked works. Steer clear of sharing in the sins and acts of disobedience of the sons of disobedience. Don't become like them by keeping unnecessary company, abetting and encouraging sinful practices, or even committing the same things.

Henry Alford: Be not therefore (since this is so—that God’s wrath comes on them) partakers with them.
(the distinction ‘Become not’ is unnecessary and indeed unsuitable: it is not a gradual ‘becoming,’ but ‘being,’ like them, which he here dehorts from.
sharers in that which they have in common, viz. these practices: their present habitude, not, their punishment, which is future)
Albert Barnes: Be not ye therefore partakers with them - Since these things displease God and expose to his wrath, avoid them.
Marvin Vincent: Be not [γινεσθε] . Lit., become not. It is a warning against lapsing into old vices.
Philip Schaff: Become; not ‘be,’ but a warning against what might take place.
Therefore; because of the fact stated in the last clause.
Partakers with them, i.e., ‘the sons of disobedience;’ sharing in their sins, which involves sharing in their punishment, but there is no direct reference to the latter.
Archibald T. Robertson: Partakers with them (συνμετοχο αυτων). Late double compound, only here in N.T., joint (συν) shares with (μετοχο) them (αυτων). These Gnostics.
John Gill: Be not ye therefore partakers with them.
In their sins, and acts of disobedience.
By keeping needless company with them; by abetting and encouraging sinful practices; by conniving at them, and not reproving for them; or by committing the same things.

bhtAttempts.bht: Do not become partakers with them is a warning against falling back into old vices that displease God and expose to His wrath. This emphasizes the importance of avoiding fellowship with wicked workers and their wicked works. It is a call to steer clear of sharing in the sins and acts of disobedience of the sons of disobedience. The admonition is to not become like them by keeping unnecessary company, abetting and encouraging sinful practices, conniving at them, or even committing the same things.

Do not become partakers with them is a warning against falling back into old vices that displease God and expose to His wrath. This emphasizes the importance of avoiding fellowship with wicked workers and their wicked works. It is a call to steer clear of sharing in the sins and acts of disobedience of the sons of disobedience. The admonition is to not become like them by keeping unnecessary company, abetting and encouraging sinful practices, or even committing the same things.

Do not become partakers with them warns against falling back into vices that displease God and expose to His wrath. Avoid fellowship with wicked workers and their wicked works. Steer clear of sharing in the sins and acts of disobedience of the sons of disobedience. Don't become like them by keeping unnecessary company, abetting and encouraging sinful practices, or even committing the same things.

Do not become partakers with them is a warning to avoid falling back into old vices that displease God and expose to His wrath. It urges believers to steer clear of fellowship with wicked workers and their sinful practices, for such participation aligns them with the sons of disobedience. This admonition emphasizes the need to refrain from keeping unnecessary company and from abetting or committing the same sins. By heeding this caution, believers can maintain their separation from the world and live righteous lives.

Do not become partakers with them is a warning to avoid falling back into old vices and sinful practices that displease God and expose to His wrath. Believers are called to abstain from joining the sons of disobedience, refraining from unnecessary company, and abstaining from abetting or committing the same sins. By heeding this caution, believers can maintain their separation from the world and live righteous lives in line with God's will.
